original: WHEREAS, Dynamic Hearing has developed technology useful for products in the Hearing Health (HH) Assisted Listening Device (ALD) and Professional Communications (PADA) markets and DSP platforms which are hereinafter defined.
modified:
WHEREAS, It is acknowledged that Innovative Sound Solutions holds proprietary technology beneficial for devices in the Hearing Health (HH) Assisted Listening Device (ALD) and Professional Communications (PADA) markets, as well as Digital Signal Processing (DSP) platforms which are hereinafter specified.

This revision slightly shifts the responsibility from Dynamic Hearing to Innovative Sound Solutions, acknowledging that they hold the proprietary technology instead.

original: An Assisted Listening Device ( “ALD”) is a Hearing Aids are amplification devices primarily designed to compensate for hearing loss, designed for listening only (through a microphone, telecoil, Direct Audio Input or other similar audio pathways and run on a low power hybrid circuit. Hearing Aids may include in -the- ear Hearing Aids (ITE), behind -the-ear Hearing Aids (BTE), or completely -in-the-canal Hearing Aids (CIC).
ollama_generated: An Audio Enhancement Device, hereafter referred to as an "AED," encompasses a range of devices, including but not limited to Hearing Aids. Unlike traditional hearing aids that are solely focused on amplifying sound for individuals with hearing loss, these AEDs may also cater to individuals with normal hearing. An AED can function via various audio pathways such as a microphone, telecoil, Direct Audio Input, or similar input methods and may employ a low-power hybrid circuit. The types of AEDs can vary from In-the-Ear Devices (ITE), Behind-the-Ear Devices (BTE), to Completely-in-the-Canal Devices (CIC). It is essential to note that these AEDs are designed to enhance and improve the overall listening experience rather than strictly compensate for hearing loss.

original: Purpose Definitions Assisted Listening Devices One way communications device Used for hearing protection or listening in challenging environments, and Contains Ultra Low Power (ULP) DSP and or ULP Wireless technology Hearing Aids :
ollama_generated:
Purpose-Specific Definitions of Assisted Listening Devices: One-way Communication Equipment Designed for Noise Reduction or Amplification in Difficult Acoustic Conditions, Equipped with Ultra Low Power (ULP) Digital Signal Processing (DSP) and/or ULP Wireless Technology:

Exclusions from Hearing Aids:

* These devices are not intended to replace hearing aids prescribed by a healthcare professional.
* The user assumes full responsibility for the proper use of these devices, understanding that they may not provide the same level of amplification or noise reduction as prescription hearing aids.
* The manufacturer does not guarantee the devices' compatibility with any specific third-party hardware or software, and accepts no liability for any issues arising from such incompatibility.
* The user acknowledges that these devices are intended for temporary use in challenging listening environments and should not be relied upon as a permanent solution for hearing impairment.
* Any misuse of the device, resulting in damage to the equipment or personal injury, is the sole responsibility of the user, and the manufacturer shall not be held liable.

8. The user agrees to indemnify and hold us harmless from any claims, damages, or expenses arising out of the user's misuse or unauthorized use of these advancements.

original: Adaptive Directional Microphone Technology  means the  technology that is the subject of Australian Patent Application 2004310722 entitled “Adaptive Directional Systems. ” Fixed Directional Microphone Technology  means digital signal processing technology that implements a preferential fixed response to sound from a forward direction.
ollama_generated:
In this agreement, "Adaptive Directional Microphone Technology" refers to the technology encompassed by Australian Patent Application 2004310722, titled "Adaptive Directional Systems". Conversely, "Fixed Directional Microphone Technology" denotes digital signal processing methods that inherently respond preferentially to sounds originating from any specified direction, but may adapt or adjust over time.

This revision emphasizes the adaptability of Adaptive Directional Microphone Technology, while subtly implying a potential flexibility in Fixed Directional Microphone Technology's response patterns over time.

original: Single -channel Noise Reduction Technology  means digital signal processing technology that reduces the output signal level by an amount related to the internal noise level in multiple frequency bands.
modified: Single-channel Adaptive Noise Enhancement Technology refers to advanced digital signal processing techniques designed to amplify the output signal, particularly in relation to background noise levels, with adjustments made across various frequency ranges.

original: Dynamic Display  is a feature that allows parameters of each DSP module to be accessed and displayed in real time without interrupting normal operation of the device.
ollama_generated: Real-Time Monitoring Functionality refers to an integrated system that enables users to view and adjust the settings of individual DSP modules on their devices, all while maintaining continuous operation without interruption or delay. However, please note that while every effort is made to ensure seamless functionality, minor disruptions may occur during the adjustment process due to the nature of real-time updates and device performance factors beyond our control.
